page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = win_create_shortcut(C Shortcut ,C Target [,C Description [,C StartIn [,C IconLocation [,C Arguments ]]]])

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: Indicates whether the function was able to create the shortcut.

argument.name: Shortcut
argument.description: The name and path to the shortcut to be created.

argument.name: Target
argument.description: The program to run upon clicking the shortcut.

argument.name: Description
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". The comment text for the shortcut.

argument.name: StartIn
argument.description: Optional. Default = target's path. The shortcut's "Start In" folder.

argument.name: IconLocation
argument.description: Optional. Default = target's path. The path to the icon to be displayed as the shortcut icon.

argument.name: Arguments
argument.description: Optional command-line arguments for the shortcut.

page.description: Creates a Windows shortcut n the specified location
page.discussion: The WIN_CREATE_SHORTCUT() function creates a Windows shortcut to the specified location.
page.example:
dim desktop as C
desktop = win_special_folder("desktop") 'Create a shortcut to Alpha Anywhere on the desktop ? win_create_shortcut(desktop + "\Launch Alpha Anywhere", a5.Get_Exe_Path() + "\alpha5.exe") = .T.
'Create the shortcut with a different icon ? win_create_shortcut(desktop + "\Launch Alpha Anywhere",a5.Get_Exe_Path() + "\alpha5.exe", "Alpha Anywhere is cool", "", "c:\windows\notepad.exe") = .T.
'Create a shortcut to Alphasports ? win_create_shortcut(desktop + "\Open Alphasports", a5.Get_Exe_Path() + "\alpha5.exe", "Launch the Alphasports sample application", "", "", "\"" + a5.Get_Exe_Path() + "\samples\alphasports\alphasports.adb\"") = .T.
